In Solution 1, the backend would be developed using Node.js, a server-side JavaScript runtime environment that allows for efficient and scalable server-side development. With Node.js, the development team can use JavaScript for both the frontend and backend, which can make development more efficient and seamless.

To create the backend, the team can use the Node.js framework, such as Express.js or Nest.js, to build RESTful APIs. The APIs would handle the communication between the frontend and the backend, and would be responsible for retrieving data from the database, updating the order status, and other necessary tasks.

For data storage, MongoDB, a NoSQL document database, would be used. MongoDB is a good choice for e-commerce applications as it allows for flexible and scalable data storage. The development team can use Mongoose, a MongoDB Object Data Modeling (ODM) library for Node.js, to interact with the database.

To integrate the backend with the frontend React app, the team can use AJAX requests to communicate with the APIs created by the backend. The team can use the Fetch API or Axios, a popular JavaScript library for making HTTP requests, to handle the AJAX requests. The responses from the backend APIs can be in the form of JSON, which can be easily parsed and used by the frontend React app.

Overall, the backend in Solution 1 would be developed using Node.js and a Node.js framework such as Express.js or Nest.js. MongoDB would be used for data storage, and Mongoose would be used to interact with the database. AJAX requests would be used to communicate with the backend APIs from the frontend React app, using the Fetch API or Axios to handle the requests.
